title: Resource Function
description: A function is a behaviour to transform inputs of any nature into outputs of any nature independently from the way it is provided (TR225)

type.description: The type/category of the resource function

role.description: Used when RF is a component of a composite RF

location.description: Location at which Resource Function is required

lifeCycleState.description: Provides the stage at which the RF has been instantiated. This is a compound state defined in TR255

lifeCycleSubState.description: Provides the usage sub-state information for the resource function. The value is dependent on the value of State. Please refer to section 3.2.7 of TR255 for details.

autoModification.description: Kinds of auto-modifications that are applied

connectivity.description: How the RFs listed in resourceRelationship are connected together
